intro: Lasiopetalum hirsutum, commonly known as the woolly matted rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually covered in a fine layer of white, woolly hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
